CatDescriptText: Mrs. Costella Ayles, restaurant employee, 233 Churchill Street, McKees Rocks, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 1, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that 18-year-olds should be given the privilege of voting?" answer reads: "Yes. At that age a boy is grown and most girls are married and have families.
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Costella Ayles wearing plaid dress with square neckline, standing on corner of Fifth and Liberty Avenues, across from Thrift Drugs and Kappels, Downtown
